text: The Fantastical Portraits or Fantasy Portraits (French: Portraits de fantaisie) are a series of portraits by the French painter Jean-Honoré Fragonard, mostly dating to 1769. It is said they were executed in a single hour, from which they gained the Italian name fa' presto (made quickly). File:Fragonard - François-Henri d'Harcourt.jpg|François-Henri d'Harcourt (1769), private collection File:Jean-Honoré Fragonard - Inspiration.jpg|Inspiration (1769), Musée du Louvre, Paris. File:Portait_d'un_homme,_anciennement_portrait_de_Denis_diderot_par_Fragonnard.jpg|Portrait of a man (1769), Musée du Louvre, Paris. title: Fantastical Portraits
